result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry D Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections and as a condition of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

- Serve 20 days in the Children's Detention Center. Report in by 12:00pm on 06-15-2022.
- Complete Cognitive Thinking Course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry D Woods

records.addlTxt: filed.
Associated with Charge #1

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered charge amended to RESIST OFFICER - FAILURE TO STOP VEHICLE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.04(2t), 346.17(2t), a Misdemeanor.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction;  with credit for 2 DAYS served.  

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 20 DAYS in the Childrens Detention Center. Report in by 12:00 PM on 6-15-2022.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Complete High School.
Perform 25 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
Complete Cogntive Thinking course. 
No driving without valid license. 

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Terry D Woods in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Terry D Woods in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Terry D Woods in court by video with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland who appears in person.  Annie Louk appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
ALL CONDITIONS OF BAIL REMAIN AS PREVIOUSLY SET

Defendant Terry D Woods in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland; both appear by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Bench warrant issued 3/8/2022. Defendant now appears with Attorney Copeland. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Terry D Woods in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Terry D Woods in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
